section.heading: Rules and regulations — Tax provisions.
section.text: Unless otherwise provided, the Mayor shall prescribe such rules and regulations as the Mayor deems necessary to carry out the provisions of this chapter.

annoGroup.heading: History
annoGroup.annotation: July 16, 1947, 61 Stat. 359, ch. 258, art. I, title XVI, § 1

annoGroup.heading: Cross References
annoGroup.annotation: Tax rate changes, authority of the Council of the District of Columbia, see § 47-504.

annoGroup.heading: Delegation of Authority
annoGroup.annotation: Delegation of authority under Law 5-32, see Mayor’s Order 83-268, November 16, 1983.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.text: Mayor authorized to issue rules and regulations: Section 201 of D.C. Law 4-118 provided that the “Mayor may prescribe such rules and regulations as the Mayor deems necessary to carry out the provisions of the District of Columbia Individuals, Estates, and Trusts Federal Conformity Tax Act of 1982.”
Mayor authorized to issue rules and regulations: Section 9 of D.C. Law 5-32 provided that the Mayor shall issue regulations necessary to carry out the provisions of the act.
